intro: Othake texanum, commonly known as Texas othake, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Othake texanum is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
